title: Compound geohazards : planning for environmental change
abstract:
This research sets out to determine the potential effects of\ud
climate change on geohazards in the UK and focuses on one\ud
of the foremost natural hazards affecting the UK — flooding.\ud
In addition to the immediate effects of flooding, areas\ud
that are prone to flooding could suffer further problems,\ud
accentuating factors such as subsidence and heave (due\ud
to the shrink-swell of clays) and reactivation of landslides.\ud
The geohazards within these potential flood zones will be\ud
heightened as a result. With this in mind, this research\ud
focuses on the potential effects of surface-water flooding\ud
(initially using the BGS Geological Indicators of Flooding\ud
dataset) on natural geohazards in the UK (as represented by\ud
BGS GeoSure layers)
